name: Master's Counterspell
prereq: Spellmaster Dedication; Master In Spell Attack Rolls And Spell Dcs
summary: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it.
description:
When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it. If you're a prepared caster, you can expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of a spell. If you're a spontaneous caster, you can expend a spell slot. The level of the prepared spell or spell slot must be at least as high as the triggering spell's level. You lose your prepared spell or spell slot as if you had Cast the Spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell, and you take a –2 penalty to your counteract check; for prepared casters, the GM might waive the penalty if the spell you're expending to counterspell is especially appropriate—such as countering with the same spell, or using a cone of cold to counteract a fireball.Traits

Abjuration: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the abjuration school of magic, typically involving protection or wards.

Archetype: This feat belongs to an archetype.
trigger: A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared, and that spell was cast or created with a tradition of magic in which you have master proficiency in spell attack rolls and spell DCs.
